metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30499 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in libcaca. A buffer overflow of export.c in function export_troff might lead to memory corruption and other potential consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30499` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

caca-utils - 0.99.beta19-2.1ubuntu1.20.04.2
libcaca0 - 0.99.beta19-2.1ubuntu1.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcaca package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.beta19-2.1ubuntu1.20.04.2').
